thread.title: Dodgers top Mets, force decisive Game 5
thread.title_full: Dodgers top Mets, force decisive Game 5

title: Dodgers top Mets, force decisive Game 5
text:
Dodgers top Mets, force decisive Game 5 Published: Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015 11:21 a.m. CDT By MIKE FITZPATRICK AP Baseball Writer 
NEW YORK (AP) — Clayton Kershaw finally came through in October, just in time to save the Los Angeles Dodgers from another early exit. 
Pitching on short rest with the season on the line, Kershaw shut down the New York Mets for seven innings and Justin Turner delivered a key hit against his former team that sent the Dodgers to a 3-1 victory Tuesday night and forced the NL Division Series to a deciding Game 5. 
The series shifts back to Los Angeles on Thursday night, with fellow Dodgers ace Zack Greinke scheduled to start against Jacob deGrom. 
The winner hosts the wild-card Chicago Cubs in the NL Championship Series opener Saturday. 
“Definitely happy to be going back home,” Kershaw said. “They like us a little better there.” 
With Chase Utley on the bench again, the Dodgers handed hometown Mets rookie Steven Matz his first loss in the major leagues.
